tutorial.speak:
To set up groups within Chums, navigate to the dashboard.
Click on People.
Choose Groups at the top of the page.
Click the plus sign to add a new group. Groups are any organization or class that you want to distinguish within your congregation.
Choose a category or create a new category.
Give your group a name.
To edit the group details, choose the group name.
Then choose the pencil icon in the top right corner.
Set up group details.
Choose a label or create a new one.
Choose whether to track attendance, parent pickup, or print labels. These categories are for childrenâ€™s classes where check-in is used. Be sure to save.
You can now add members to your group.
Type an individual's name or leave it blank to search your entire database.
Choose members for your group.
In this case, the members will show up in the Ushers group.
Click the message icon to send a message to all of your group members.
The message will be sent to their B1 app or their email if they do not have the B1 app.
Hit send.
You can also download a CSV of the group members by clicking the download icon.
Your group now shows up under Groups.
